intro: Ascochilus emarginatus, commonly known as the marginate ascochilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a distinctive margin that is notched or emarginate, giving the species its scientific name. Ascochilus emarginatus is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
